name: SMS Management Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me send and manage short messages efficiently.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that recipients of my short messages will be identified primarily by phone numbers or similar unique contact identifiers.
I want to specify the content of each short message directly in a text input field before sending.
I expect the system to support sending messages to both individual recipients and multiple recipients in a single action.
I assume the system will manage my own single user account context rather than requiring me to switch between multiple accounts frequently.
I want my user information to include standard personal and contact details such as name, phone number, and email address.
I expect configuration of sending policies to include scheduling options such as immediate send or delayed send times.
I expect configuration of sending policies to include rules controlling message frequency to avoid sending too many messages in a short period.
I want short message sending records to display key details such as recipient, message content preview, send time, and delivery result.
I expect monitoring of short message sending situations to include high-level statistics such as counts of sent, delivered, and failed messages.
I expect monitoring of short message sending situations to include status indicators for ongoing or recently sent messages.
I want to be able to update my user information through editable forms rather than needing external assistance.
I prefer to configure sending policies through a dedicated settings or configuration area instead of adjusting them each time I send a message.
I want to access short message sending records via a dedicated history or records section that I can revisit at any time.
I prefer to monitor short message sending situations using an interactive dashboard rather than static reports.
I want navigation between message sending, user information management, policy configuration, and monitoring to be available within a single unified interface.
I expect the azure mist background color to be applied consistently across all main screens of the platform.
I want all primary interface components such as buttons, forms, and tables to use dark slate blue as their main styling color.
I expect text and data in the sending records and monitoring views to remain clearly readable against the azure mist background and dark slate blue components.
I prefer that charts, tables, and status indicators in the monitoring area follow the same azure mist and dark slate blue visual theme.
I expect the overall visual theme with azure mist background and dark slate blue components to remain consistent regardless of which feature I am using.

URL: As a user, I want to send short messages so that I can communicate through the short message service platform.
As a user, I want to manage user information so that I can keep my account and related details up to date.
As a user, I want to configure sending policies so that I can control how my short messages are sent.
As a user, I want to view short message sending records so that I can track the messages I have sent.
As a user, I want to monitor short message sending situations so that I can understand the status and performance of my sent messages.
As a user, I want the platform to apply azure mist as the background so that the interface has a consistent visual theme.
As a user, I want all components styled with dark slate blue so that the platform has a uniform and visually appealing design.
instruction: Please implement a short message service platform for sending and managing short messages. The platform should have functionalities for sending short messages, managing user information, configuring policies, and monitoring short message sending situations. Users should be able to send short messages, view short message sending records, configure sending policies, and monitor short message sending situations. Apply azure mist as the background; style all components with dark slate blue.

name: Supply Chain Traceability Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me understand and verify where my products come from and how they move through the supply chain.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each product can be uniquely identified by a single product ID that does not clash with any other product in the system.
I expect to be able to associate each product ID with basic product metadata such as name, type, and origin at the time of registration.
I expect the system to manage traceability for many products at once rather than only for a small, fixed number of items.
I assume the system will cover the full supply chain lifecycle of a product, from initial registration through final delivery or completion.
I expect the system to capture and store all relevant handover or transfer events that occur as products move between supply chain participants.
I expect each product’s circulation path to include a sequence of locations and supply chain actors involved in handling the product.
I expect the current status of a product to include at least its current location and the party currently responsible for it.
I assume the system will maintain timestamps for key product events so that movements and status changes can be understood in time order.
I expect product authenticity verification to rely on comparing the recorded product history and origin data with what is claimed or expected.
I expect supply chain statistics to be based on aggregated data such as counts of products, movements, and statuses over time.
I expect supply chain analysis results to highlight trends and patterns rather than just listing raw event data.
I expect to be able to look up information about a product by entering its product ID into the system.
I expect to access product status, circulation paths, statistics, and analysis through on-demand queries instead of only receiving scheduled reports.
I assume I can filter and narrow down queries by criteria such as time period, product type, or supply chain participant when viewing statistics or analysis.
I prefer the circulation path of a product to be presented as an ordered timeline or route showing each step in sequence.
I prefer product status information to be displayed in a concise summary view that shows the most important fields at a glance.
I expect data statistics to be shown in an aggregated, visual form such as tables or charts instead of only as lists of individual events.
I prefer data analysis results to include visual elements such as charts or graphs that make it easy to interpret supply chain performance.
I expect authenticity verification results to be presented clearly as a simple outcome accompanied by a brief explanation of the basis for that outcome.

URL: As a user, I want to register products with unique product IDs so that I can add them into the supply chain traceability system.
As a user, I want to track the circulation path of products so that I can understand how products move through the supply chain.
As a user, I want to query the current status of products so that I can know their present condition or location in the supply chain.
As a user, I want to verify the authenticity of products so that I can confirm their origin and legitimacy.
As a user, I want to view data statistics about the supply chain so that I can understand its overall operation.
As a user, I want to view data analysis results for the supply chain so that I can gain insights into how it is performing.
instruction: Please implement a supply chain traceability website for tracking and verifying the origin and circulation of products with the unique product IDs. The website should have functionalities for product registration, tracking, inquiry, and verification. Users should be able to register products, track the circulation path of products, query the current status of products, and verify the authenticity of products. The website should also have data statistics and analysis functions to help users understand the operation of the supply chain. Define the background as misty rose and components as firebrick.

name: Paper Cup Manufacturing Manager
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me oversee and control the production and business operations of my paper cup manufacturing.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to identify each type of raw material with a unique name or code so I can distinguish between different materials used in paper cup manufacturing.
I want to identify each finished product variant with a unique name or code so I can differentiate between different types or sizes of paper cups.
I want to identify customers by a unique customer identifier so I can reliably link sales and history records to the correct customer.
I want to identify each sales transaction with a unique reference so I can trace and review individual sales records when needed.
I want the system to cover both raw materials and finished products together so that all relevant stock for my business is overseen from a single place.
I want the system to cover both inventory and sales aspects of my operations so I do not need separate tools for stock and sales tracking.
I want the system to manage customer information only to the extent needed to support sales tracking and reporting, not as a standalone CRM with unrelated features.
I want the reporting functions to be based only on data that has been entered or recorded within the system, not on external data sources.
I want inventory records for raw materials to include both quantity and unit of measure so that stock levels make sense for each material type.
I want inventory records for finished products to include quantities that correspond to how I pack or sell cups, such as pieces, sleeves, or cartons.
I want records of raw material usage to include the specific production batches or orders they are consumed in so I can relate usage to production activities.
I want sales records for finished products to include the customer, date, and quantity sold so I can later analyze sales patterns and customer behavior.
I want sales records for raw materials to include the reason or type of transaction so I can distinguish between normal sales and other material disposals.
I want customer records to include basic contact details such as name, phone, and address so I can follow up on orders and maintain relationships.
I want customer sales history to be organized per customer so I can see all past purchases grouped for each customer.
I want production management information to show which finished products were produced, in what quantities, and when they were produced.
I want reports on raw materials to combine inventory balances with usage and sales figures so I can see the complete picture for each material.
I want reports on finished products to include both current stock and historical sales numbers so I can evaluate product performance.
I want sales statistics to summarize sales volumes and values over time so I can quickly assess overall business performance.
I want to record inventory, usage, and sales data through form-based inputs so I can enter information in a structured way.
I want to be able to review and update recorded entries so I can correct mistakes or adjust information when needed.
I want to navigate between raw materials, finished products, inventory, production, sales, and customers using clearly separated sections or menus.
I want reporting and statistics to be accessible on demand rather than automatically pushed, so I can generate them whenever I need insights.
I want to be able to filter and sort records such as inventory lists and sales histories so I can quickly find the information I am interested in.
I want the interface background consistently displayed in light goldenrod so the system visually aligns with my chosen branding.
I want primary UI elements such as buttons, menu items, and key controls to use an olive drab color so the visual theme appears cohesive.
I want reports and statistics to be presented in tabular form with clear labels so I can read and interpret the data easily.
I want inventory and sales views to display quantities and dates prominently so I can assess current status and trends at a glance.
I want the interface to maintain a simple and uncluttered layout so that overseeing production and business operations remains straightforward.

URL: As a user, I want to manage raw materials so that I can keep track of the resources needed for paper cup manufacturing.
As a user, I want to manage finished products so that I can organize the paper cups ready for sale.
As a user, I want to manage inventory so that I can monitor stock levels of raw materials and finished products.
As a user, I want to manage production so that I can oversee the paper cup manufacturing process.
As a user, I want to manage sales so that I can handle the selling of paper cups.
As a user, I want to record the inventory of raw materials so that I can know how much material is available.
As a user, I want to record the inventory of finished products so that I can know how many paper cups are in stock.
As a user, I want to track the inventory of raw materials so that I can monitor stock changes over time.
As a user, I want to track the inventory of finished products so that I can monitor available products for sale.
As a user, I want to record the usage of raw materials so that I can understand how materials are consumed during production.
As a user, I want to record the sales of raw materials so that I can keep a history of any raw material transactions.
As a user, I want to record the sales of finished products so that I can maintain accurate sales records.
As a user, I want to track the sales of raw materials so that I can analyze raw material sales activities.
As a user, I want to track the sales of finished products so that I can analyze product sales performance.
As a user, I want to generate detailed reports on raw materials so that I can review inventory, usage, and sales data.
As a user, I want to generate detailed reports on finished products so that I can review inventory and sales performance.
As a user, I want to have customer management capabilities so that I can maintain organized customer records.
As a user, I want to record customer information so that I can keep contact and profile details for customers.
As a user, I want to record customer sales history so that I can see what each customer has purchased.
As a user, I want to view sales statistics so that I can analyze overall sales performance.
As a user, I want the system background to use a light goldenrod color so that the interface matches the specified design.
As a user, I want the UI elements to use an olive drab color so that the interface components follow the required theme.
instruction: Please implement a paper cup manufacturing system to manage inventory, production, and sales of paper cups. The system should have functionalities for managing raw materials, finished products, inventory, production, and sales. Users should be able to record and track the inventory, usage, and sales of raw materials and finished products, and generate detailed reports. The system should also have customer management capabilities, including recording customer information, sales history, and sales statistics. Assign light goldenrod to the background and olive drab to the UI elements.

name: Hospital Management Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me centrally manage and monitor all key hospital operations and records.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the system to cover all major operational areas of the hospital, including finance, pharmacy, laboratory, theater, and patient records, within a single centralized application.

I assume that hospital operations such as finances, inventory, patient records, lab, and theater activities can all be uniquely identified and managed by their existing internal reference numbers, dates, and departmental identifiers.
I expect the same system used for operational management to also be used for reporting, without relying on separate reporting tools.
I want financial information in the system to be detailed enough to support both day‑to‑day transaction tracking and higher‑level financial status review.
I expect patient fee collection data to be tightly linked to individual patient records so that every payment can be traced back to a specific patient and visit.
I want financial reports to aggregate and summarize all relevant financial transactions recorded in the system, rather than requiring manual consolidation.
I expect inventory reporting to cover all consumable and non‑consumable hospital items that are managed through the system, not only medicines.
I want inventory reports to be derived from the same data used for day‑to‑day inventory updates so that there is a single source of truth for stock information.
I expect patient reports to be generated from existing patient records without requiring duplicate or parallel data entry.
I expect all hospital employees who produce daily activity information to use this system as the standard channel for submitting their daily reports.
I assume employees will interact with the system directly to enter their daily reports rather than sending them through intermediate staff or external tools.
I expect employee daily reports to include enough structured details about activities to be understandable and reviewable by their superiors without additional clarification.
I want pharmacy inventory management to include both current stock levels and transaction history such as issues, receipts, and adjustments for medicines.
I expect pharmacy stock information in the system to be considered the authoritative record for medicine availability within the hospital.
I expect patient electronic files to store at least the patient name, visit date, diagnosis, and comments as standard fields for each visit.
I assume that all patient encounters handled by the hospital will be recorded as electronic files in the system rather than kept only on paper.
I want claim formulation in the system to reuse existing patient and financial data instead of entering the same information again when preparing claims.
I expect all hospital claims that are to be managed and processed to be created and tracked within this system.
I want laboratory operations management to cover the registration, processing, and result recording for lab requests handled by the hospital.
I assume that laboratory activities relevant to patient care will be coordinated through the system rather than using separate lab‑only software.
I want theater operations management to handle scheduling and status tracking for surgical or procedure theaters that the hospital operates.
I assume that all formal theater activities requiring coordination and tracking will be recorded in the system instead of using manual logs.
I expect the peach puff background color to be applied consistently across all pages and modules of the system’s web interface.
I assume that indian red will be used consistently for key interface components such as headers, buttons, or highlights in alignment with the hospital’s visual theme.
I want the chosen background and component colors to remain fixed as part of the standard theme rather than being changed dynamically by end users.
I expect users to access all these management and reporting capabilities through a unified web-based interface rather than separate applications per department.
I assume that users will select departments, patients, and operational units from predefined lists in the system instead of entering free‑form text for identification.
I expect the system to support multiple user roles such as general users, employees, and superiors all working within the same hospital environment.
I expect that generating any type of report will be initiated by the user on demand rather than only being generated automatically on a fixed schedule.

URL: As a user, I want to manage hospital finances so that the hospital's financial operations are organized and controlled.
As a user, I want to collect patient fees so that patient payments are properly recorded and processed.
As a user, I want to generate financial reports so that I can review the hospital's financial status.
As a user, I want to generate inventory reports so that I can monitor hospital inventory usage and levels.
As a user, I want to generate patient reports so that I can review patient-related information and statistics.
As an employee, I want to submit daily reports to my superiors so that they can understand my detailed daily activities.
As a user, I want to manage pharmacy inventory of medicines so that medicine stock is accurately tracked and maintained.
As a user, I want to manage patient electronic files including patient name, date of visit, diagnosis, and comments so that complete patient records are maintained.
As a user, I want to formulate claims so that hospital claims can be properly managed and processed.
As a user, I want to manage laboratory operations so that lab-related activities are organized within the system.
As a user, I want to manage theater operations so that surgical or procedure theaters are efficiently organized.
As a user, I want the website background color configured to peach puff so that the overall interface matches the required theme.
As a user, I want components to use indian red so that the interface components follow the specified color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a hospital management website for managing hospital finances, reports, inventory, and patient information. The website should have financial management functionality, including collecting patient fees and managing hospital finances. The reporting functionality should include inventory reports, patient reports, and financial reports. Employees should be able to submit daily reports to superiors, including detailed information about daily activities. Pharmacy management should include inventory management of medicines. Patient electronic files should include patient name, date of visit, diagnosis, and comments. The website should also have claim formulation, laboratory management, and theater management. Configure the background color to peach puff, with components using indian red.

name: E-Government Integrated Management Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system to help manage and coordinate various government administrative and decision-making activities in a unified way.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that office, infrastructure, procurement, personnel, financial, and decision-making management together constitute the main administrative domains that must be covered by the unified e-government system.
I expect the same user account to access all management domains in the e-government system without needing separate logins for each module.
I assume that management items in the system can be uniquely identified by standard administrative identifiers such as document numbers, project codes, or application IDs.
I expect each management domain to provide the specific fields and data elements commonly used in existing government paper forms and spreadsheets.
I prefer that similar operations such as creating, viewing, and updating items work in a consistent way across all management modules.
I expect that my ability to submit or approve applications is determined automatically based on my organizational role and not selected manually each time.
I assume that browsing, submitting, approving, querying, and performing related operations are the core interactions that should be available across all relevant management modules.
I expect that when I browse related information about management items, I will see both summary information and a way to access full details if needed.
I prefer to initiate administrative processes directly from the relevant management module rather than going through a separate generic workflow menu.
I expect that approving applications will be possible both from a dedicated approval list and from within the detailed view of an application.
I assume that when I query the status of my applications, I can search using simple filters such as date range, process type, and current status.
I expect that the status of an application will be expressed in clearly understandable administrative terms such as pending, approved, rejected, or returned for revision.
I assume that leave, middle-level cadres leaving Shenzhen, attendance, and five powers management are treated as distinct submodules within the broader personnel or office management areas.
I expect the system to embed all mandatory information required by current government regulations into the designed forms for leave, travel, attendance, and five powers management.
I prefer using predesigned electronic forms instead of uploading external documents or attachments for leave, travel, attendance, and five powers workflows.
I expect that when I fill out a designed form, the system will guide me step by step in the order that matches existing paper-based procedures.
I assume that circulation of forms will follow existing organizational approval chains and not require me to manually define a routing path for each case.
I prefer to be able to see where a form currently is in the circulation chain and who is responsible for the next action.
I assume that the system will automatically use organizational structure information to determine the next approver when circulating forms.
I expect the light pink page background to be applied consistently across all pages and modules of the system.
I assume that the medium violet red color for interface elements applies to key UI components such as buttons, menus, and section headers.
I expect that despite the light pink background and medium violet red elements, text and data will remain easily readable with sufficient contrast.
I prefer that system notifications, status indicators, and important prompts visually fit within the specified light pink and medium violet red color scheme.
I expect navigation between office, infrastructure, procurement, personnel, financial, and decision-making management modules to be available from a common main menu.

URL: As a user, I want to use office management functions so that I can handle daily office-related tasks in the e-government system.
As a user, I want to use infrastructure management functions so that I can manage infrastructure-related affairs in the e-government system.
As a user, I want to use procurement management functions so that I can manage procurement-related processes in the e-government system.
As a user, I want to use personnel management functions so that I can handle staff-related information and processes in the e-government system.
As a user, I want to use financial management functions so that I can manage financial-related matters in the e-government system.
As a user, I want to use decision-making management functions so that I can support and manage decision-making processes in the e-government system.
As a user, I want to browse related information so that I can understand the details of various management items in the system.
As a user, I want to submit applications so that I can initiate various administrative processes within the system.
As a user, I want to approve applications so that I can complete required approval steps in administrative workflows.
As a user, I want to query the status of my applications so that I can track their progress in the system.
As a user, I want to perform related operations on management items so that I can complete necessary tasks in each management module.
As a user, I want to use leave management functions so that I can handle leave-related applications and approvals.
As a user, I want to use middle-level cadres leaving Shenzhen management functions so that I can manage applications and approvals for such trips.
As a user, I want to use attendance functions so that I can manage and view attendance-related records and processes.
As a user, I want to use "five powers" management functions so that I can manage processes related to the five powers within the system.

As a user, I want the system to provide designed forms and processes for leave, middle-level cadres leaving Shenzhen, attendance, and "five powers" management so that I can complete these workflows in a standardized way.

As a user, I want the system to support circulation of forms and processes for leave, middle-level cadres leaving Shenzhen, attendance, and "five powers" management so that I can route them through the required steps.
As a user, I want the page background to be light pink so that the system interface follows the required visual style.
As a user, I want interface elements to be medium violet red so that the system elements are consistent with the specified design.
instruction: Please implement an e-government system for office management, infrastructure management, procurement management, personnel management, financial management, and decision-making management. The system should have functionalities for office management, infrastructure management, procurement management, personnel management, financial management, and decision-making management. Users should be able to browse related information, submit applications, approve, query status, and perform related operations. The system should also include functions such as leave, middle-level cadres leaving Shenzhen, attendance, and "five powers" management, which can design and circulate corresponding forms and processes. Implement light pink for the page background and medium violet red for the elements.

name: Employee Attendance Tracker
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me track and review employee attendance.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each employee will be uniquely identifiable in the system so that individual clock-in and clock-out actions can be associated with the correct person.
I expect the system to infer my role (user or administrator) from my account so that I do not have to specify it every time I access attendance functions.
I want the system to handle multiple clock-in and clock-out events per day for a single employee when necessary, rather than restricting attendance to a single daily entry.
I expect attendance records to cover at least complete working days, not just isolated timestamps, so that daily presence and absence can be understood.
I want administrators to be able to access attendance records for all employees within the organization, not just a subset of staff.
I assume the system will maintain historical attendance data over an extended period so that both users and administrators can review past attendance patterns.
I expect each attendance record to include both the date and the specific clock-in and clock-out times so that presence intervals are clearly defined.
I want absence information to be derived from missing or incomplete attendance events within expected working hours rather than requiring separate manual absence entries.
I expect my attendance history view to present entries in a chronological order so that I can easily follow my attendance over time.
I want administrative statistics on attendance to summarize aggregated measures such as counts or averages of presence and absences over chosen time ranges.
I expect administrative analysis features to allow comparison between different employees or time periods so that patterns and trends can be identified.
I assume attendance records visible to administrators will include enough detail, such as employee identifiers and dates, to differentiate between employees and days.
I want clock-in and clock-out actions to be triggered by simple, single-step interactions so that recording attendance does not require navigating through multiple screens.
I expect the system to immediately confirm successful clock-in and clock-out actions so that I know my attendance times have been recorded.
I want to be able to navigate quickly between the attendance recording functions and my attendance history so that I can verify my entries without extra steps.
I expect administrators to have dedicated views or controls for statistics and analysis so that these functions are clearly separated from basic record viewing.
I want my attendance history to be presented in a tabular or list format where each entry clearly shows date, clock-in time, and clock-out time.
I expect absence information in my records to be visually distinguishable from presence information so that I can quickly see when I was not present.
I want papaya whip as the base color to be applied consistently across backgrounds or primary surfaces of the interface so that the theme appears uniform.
I expect dark orange to be used consistently for interactive components such as buttons, highlights, or key UI elements to maintain visual coherence.
I assume that the chosen colors will be applied in a way that keeps text and data in attendance views clearly readable.
I want administrative statistics and analysis results to be displayed in an aggregated, easy-to-scan format such as summary numbers or charts, rather than raw records only.

URL: As a user, I want to clock in so that my attendance time is recorded.
As a user, I want to clock out so that my departure time is recorded.
As a user, I want to view my own attendance records so that I can track my attendance history.
As a user, I want to view my attendance time in my records so that I know when I was present.
As a user, I want to view my absence time in my records so that I understand when I was not present.
As an administrator, I want to view all employees' attendance records so that I can monitor overall attendance.
As an administrator, I want to perform statistics on attendance records so that I can understand attendance patterns.
As an administrator, I want to perform analysis on attendance records so that I can gain insights into employee attendance.
As a user, I want the system interface to use papaya whip as the base color so that the visual theme is consistent.
As a user, I want all components to use dark orange so that the system’s elements have a unified appearance.
instruction: Please implement a time attendance system to record employee attendance. The system should have functionalities for employee clocking in and out, and viewing attendance records. Employees should be able to clock in and out, and view their own attendance records, including attendance time and absence time. Administrators should be able to view all employees' attendance records, perform statistics, and analysis. Specify papaya whip as the base color and dark orange for all components.

name: Barber Shop Management System
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me manage my barbershop’s staff, services, and client communication.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to identify each barber primarily by their name when browsing or managing barbers.
I want to identify each service primarily by its service name when browsing or managing services.
I expect the system to handle multiple barbers at the same time, not just a single barber.
I expect the system to support multiple different services offered simultaneously.
I assume the system will handle a list of clients large enough that manual communication with each one individually is impractical.
I want to see each barber’s availability status when I browse barbers.
I want to see basic descriptive details for each barber, such as their name and possibly their role or specialization, when I browse barbers.
I want to see a concise description of each service, including at least its name and type, when I browse services.
I want to specify at least a name and a short description when adding a new service.
I want to specify at least a name and basic profile details when adding a new barber.
I expect the system to store clients’ phone numbers so it can send WhatsApp notifications to them.
I want to browse barbers through a simple visual list or catalog that I can scroll through.
I want to browse services through a simple visual list or catalog that I can scroll through.
I want to add new barbers and services using straightforward forms within the interface.
I expect to trigger WhatsApp notifications directly from within the system instead of switching manually to WhatsApp.
I want the process of sending WhatsApp notifications to require only a few simple steps from my side.
I want the snow background theme to be visible across the main pages where I manage barbers, services, and client communication.
I expect the dim gray color to be used as a dominant color in the interface, such as for menus, headers, or primary elements.
I want the snow background styling to be decorative and not obstruct the readability of text or important interface elements.
I expect text and icons to be clearly distinguishable against the dim gray interface elements.

URL: As a user, I want to browse barbers so that I can see which barbers are available.
As a user, I want to browse services so that I can see what services the barber shop offers.
As a user, I want to add new barbers so that I can manage the barbers available in the shop.
As a user, I want to add new services so that I can manage the services offered in the shop.
As a user, I want to send WhatsApp notifications so that I can notify clients.
As a user, I want the layout styled with snow in the background so that the website has the requested visual theme.
As a user, I want the interface to use dim gray so that the website matches the desired color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a barber shop management website for managing barbers and services. The website should have functionalities for adding barbers, services, and sending WhatsApp notifications. Users should be able to browse barbers and services, add new barbers and services, and send notifications to clients. Style the layout with snow in the background and dim gray for the interface.

name: Women's Health Survey Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps women conveniently provide and manage their health information through surveys.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the system to distinguish between different types of health surveys so that I can choose the one that is relevant to my situation.
I want survey questions to clearly indicate which answer format is required, such as multiple choice, checkboxes, or free text.
I expect the system to support multiple health surveys over time so that I can provide updated health information when needed.
I want the system to handle both initial health information and subsequent updates within the same data set.
I assume that all of my survey responses will be included in the collected data unless I explicitly choose not to submit them.
I expect survey questions to be specific to women’s health and not include irrelevant medical topics.
I want the system to store my personal and health-related details together so that my survey responses can be understood in context.
I expect data management functions to allow me to see my previously submitted survey information in an organized way.
I want data review functions to highlight incomplete or inconsistent answers in my survey responses.
I expect reporting functions to focus on aggregating and summarizing my own health information over time rather than on other users’ data.
I prefer to access the system through a web interface so that I can fill out surveys using a browser.
I want to be able to navigate back and forth between survey questions before final submission.
I expect submitting a survey to be a single, clear action such as clicking a submit button at the end of the survey.
I want the system to confirm successful submission of my survey so that I know my information has been received.
I expect permission management settings to be accessible through a dedicated section where I can adjust who can access my health data.
I want data review and reporting options to be available via menu items or clearly labeled sections on the website.
I expect survey forms and data displays to be visually readable against the whitesmoke background.
I want dark cyan styling to be consistently applied to interactive components such as buttons, links, and form controls.

I expect the system to present my personality assessment results in a clear, understandable format that highlights implications for coaching.
I want coaches to see my profile in a concise, organized layout so they can quickly understand my situation before sessions.
I expect coach search and matching results to be shown as a list or similar structure that allows easy comparison between coaches.
I want my scheduled coaching sessions to be displayed on a timeline or calendar-style view so I can easily see upcoming and past sessions.
I expect my goals and related progress to be visualized in a way that makes trends over time easy to understand at a glance.

instruction: Please implement a web application for one-to-one coaching sessions to match coaches and users. The application should have functionalities such as personality assessment, user profiles, coaching and mentorship matching, scheduling and session management, and goal setting and progress tracking. Users should be able to complete a personality assessment, create and manage their profiles, search for and select suitable coaches, schedule coaching sessions, and set and track goals. Set the background to beige, and apply saddle brown to components.

name: Virtual Study Group Hub
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me connect with others to study together and collaborate on learning projects online.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify study groups primarily by attributes such as group name, subject, or project topic when creating or joining them.
I assume a single user account will allow me to participate in multiple study groups at the same time.
I expect that study groups will be focused on specific subjects, courses, or projects rather than being completely general-purpose communities.
I expect study groups to support sharing different types of learning resources, such as documents, slides, links, or media files.
I assume that resources shared in a study group will be visible to all members of that group by default.
I expect that project collaboration within study groups will be anchored to specific projects or assignments rather than being unstructured.
I expect creating a study group to be initiated by a simple action such as clicking a clearly labeled button or link.
I assume that joining an existing study group will be possible through a straightforward action from a list or search results of available groups.
I expect to be able to upload or attach resources directly within a study group interface when sharing materials.
I assume that downloading shared resources will be possible with a direct download action from within the study group view.
I expect project discussions to take place in a dedicated discussion area that is clearly associated with a specific project inside the study group.
I assume that there will be a clearly labeled entry point, such as a menu item or icon, to access my personal center.
I expect the personal center to present my profile information in a structured, readable layout rather than as raw data.
I assume that the alice blue background color will be applied consistently across all major website pages, including group and personal center views.
I expect the steel blue component color to be applied consistently to interactive elements such as buttons, tabs, and navigation controls.
I assume that the chosen alice blue and steel blue colors will provide sufficient visual contrast to clearly distinguish components from the background.
I expect the overall interface theme to remain visually consistent so that switching between study groups, discussions, and the personal center feels uniform.

instruction: Please implement a virtual study group website where users can create or join study groups, share resources, and collaborate on projects. The website should have functionalities for creating and joining groups, sharing resources, and collaborating on projects. Users should be able to join groups, download resources, and participate in project discussions. The website should also have a personal center where users can view their personal information. Configure all backgrounds with alice blue and all components with steel blue.

name: Adult Vocabulary Learning Hub
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me steadily expand and reinforce my adult vocabulary in an engaging way.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the system to determine which words are at an appropriate adult difficulty level without me having to manually classify them.
I expect the system to identify and group vocabulary words into weekly sets of 10 without requiring me to curate them myself.
I want the vocabulary focus to be on general adult language use rather than specialized or technical jargon.
I want my vocabulary practice to cover both word meanings and how those words are used in sentences.
I want all the different games and exercises to draw from a shared pool of vocabulary so that my practice feels coherent.
I want the number of weekly words (10) to remain consistent over time so that my learning pace is predictable.
I prefer vocabulary activities that emphasize adult-relevant themes and contexts rather than child-oriented topics.
I want each vocabulary word to have example usages that sound natural in everyday adult communication.
I want synonyms and antonyms presented for each targeted word rather than having to look them up externally.
I expect the blog content to include tips, explanations, and articles that directly relate to improving adult vocabulary.
I want the simple waiting-room game to use the same vocabulary words I am learning elsewhere in the system.
I want to be able to select and switch between different activity types without losing my overall learning progress.
I want games and quizzes to be quick to start and complete so that I can fit them into short free moments.
I expect to be able to repeat activities and reattempt words that I previously got wrong.
I want to navigate from the home page to any quiz, game, or content section in at most a couple of clicks.
I expect selecting an avatar to be a one-time or occasional action that is easily accessible from the main navigation.
I want the dashboard to be reachable from the home page and from learning activities without needing to start over.
I want the dashboard to show my progress at a glance without requiring me to open multiple pages.
I expect progress summaries to reflect both the number of words I have learned and how consistently I have studied over weeks.
I want activity pages to share a consistent layout so that I do not have to relearn how to use each new game.
I want the light gray background to be used broadly on main content areas, not just isolated sections.
I expect dark red main components to include primary navigation items and key interactive controls so they are easy to spot.
I want the overall visual style to remain consistent between the home page, activity pages, and blog pages.
I prefer a clean, uncluttered layout where vocabulary content is more prominent than decorative elements.

URL: As a user, I want to access a variety of quizzes and word games so that I can learn adult vocabulary in different ways.
As a user, I want to play crossword puzzles so that I can practice vocabulary through puzzle solving.
As a user, I want to play unjumble letters games so that I can reinforce my spelling and word recognition.
As a user, I want to find synonyms and antonyms so that I can expand my vocabulary depth and nuance.
As a user, I want to use flashcards so that I can memorize and review vocabulary efficiently.
As a user, I want to complete fill-in-the-blank exercises so that I can practice using new words in context.
As a user, I want to view a dashboard that displays a progress summary so that I can track my learning over time.
As a user, I want to learn a set of 10 new words every week so that I can steadily build my vocabulary.
As a user, I want to choose an avatar so that I can personalize my learning experience.
As a user, I want to play a simple game in the waiting room so that I stay engaged while waiting.
As a user, I want to access a home page so that I can navigate to different parts of the website.
As a user, I want to access 5 activity pages so that I can engage in different vocabulary learning activities.
As a user, I want to access blog pages so that I can read additional content related to vocabulary learning.
As a user, I want body backgrounds to be light gray so that the interface is easy on my eyes.
As a user, I want main components to be dark red so that key interface elements are visually distinct.
instruction: Please implement an adult vocabulary learning website that includes a variety of quizzes and word games, such as crossword puzzles, unjumble letters, finding synonyms and antonyms, flashcards, and fill-in-the-blank. The website should have a dashboard that displays a progress summary. A set of 10 new words should be taught every week, and users should be able to choose an avatar and play a simple game while waiting in the waiting room. The website should include a home page, 5 activity pages, a dashboard, and blog pages. Assign light gray to body backgrounds and dark red to main components.

name: Kids Recycling Adventure
initial_requirements: I need a fun online game that helps children learn how to recycle waste correctly.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume the game will focus specifically on household and everyday waste types that children commonly encounter.
I expect the game to cover multiple categories of recyclable and non-recyclable waste, not just a single material type.
I want to identify waste items primarily through simple visual icons or illustrations rather than text-heavy descriptions.
I expect to interact with waste items by using basic point-and-click or drag-and-drop actions that are easy for children to perform.
I prefer that each game round is short so that I can quickly see results and stay engaged.
I expect the competitive elements such as leaderboards to be optional so that I can still play even if I’m not interested in competition.
I want the game to respond immediately when I sort an item so that I feel a direct connection between my action and the outcome.
I assume I will be able to play multiple rounds in a row without needing to restart the website.
I want the game to increase in difficulty as I improve so that I am gradually challenged with more complex sorting situations.
I expect the feedback to indicate not only whether my sorting choice is correct or incorrect but also what the correct container should be.
I prefer that the rewards are tied to my correct recycling decisions so that I clearly see a link between learning and recognition.
I expect the leaderboard to rank players based on points or performance metrics related to correct sorting and game progress.
I want the overall art style, including characters and objects, to be playful and exaggerated to match the cartoon theme.
I expect color choices like seashell and crimson to be applied consistently to similar UI elements so that the interface feels coherent.
I prefer that textual information, such as instructions and feedback, is short and easy to read for children.
I assume the game screen will be free of clutter so that the waste items and containers are visually prominent.
I want the leaderboard and rewards displays to use the same visual style as the rest of the game so that they feel integrated rather than separate.
I expect to access the game directly through a web browser without needing to install additional software.
I assume the game is intended for individual play rather than simultaneous multi-user sessions on the same device.
I prefer that I can start playing quickly with minimal setup or configuration before the first game round.

As a user, I want the game to include a leaderboard so that competitive elements keep me engaged and motivated.
As a user, I want the game to have a cartoon-style visual design so that it is visually appealing to me as a child.
As a user, I want to play the recycling game so that I can interactively participate in learning activities.
As a user, I want to receive feedback while playing the game so that I can understand how well I am doing.
As a user, I want to learn how to correctly sort waste into the corresponding containers so that I can practice proper recycling.
As a user, I want to receive rewards and recognition through the game so that I feel encouraged to keep playing and improving.
As a user, I want the container backgrounds to use a seashell color so that the visual design of the containers is consistent and appealing.
As a user, I want the component visuals to use a crimson color so that the visual elements of the game are clearly styled.
instruction: Please develop a children's recycling game website to educate kids on proper waste recycling. The game should include competitive elements such as a leaderboard to keep kids engaged and motivated. The game should use a cartoon-style visual design to make it visually appealing to children. Kids should be able to play the game, receive feedback, learn how to correctly sort waste into the corresponding containers, and receive rewards and recognition through the game. Use seashell for container backgrounds and crimson for component visuals.

name: DMV Practice Test Website
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me prepare for my driver's license exam.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume the system is focused only on the theoretical/written portion of the driver’s license exam and not on practical driving tests.
I expect the practice content to cover all major topics that can appear in the driver’s license exam, such as traffic rules, road signs, and safe driving practices.
I expect to identify which practice questions to attempt by selecting them from a visible list or set of options provided by the system.
I expect to specify particular topics or categories for practice using filters, tags, or some form of topic selection mechanism.
I prefer to be able to repeatedly access the same question bank for ongoing practice over multiple study sessions.
I expect to start and submit simulated exams through clear actions such as pressing a start and finish button rather than through implicit triggers.
I expect the question-selection interaction for focused study to be separate from the interaction used to start a full simulated exam.
I expect simulated exams to contain a fixed number of questions that is representative of an actual driver’s license exam in my region.
I assume simulated exams will use questions drawn from the same question bank that I can otherwise practice with.
I want the scoring of simulated exams to reflect how the real exam is graded, including how correct and incorrect answers affect the final score.
I expect exam scores to show at least a total score or percentage that summarizes my performance for each simulated exam attempt.
I expect error analysis to include both the questions I answered incorrectly and an explanation or indication of the correct answers.
I assume error analysis will be available after completing each simulated exam, not only at the end of all my study sessions.
I expect exam scores to be displayed in a clearly visible results area immediately after I complete a simulated exam.
I prefer error analysis to be organized so that I can easily distinguish between correct and incorrect responses for each completed exam.
I expect the floral white background color to be applied consistently across all pages and views of the system.
I expect every visible user interface component, such as buttons, headings, and borders, to use the same dark goldenrod color for a unified appearance.
I assume that the floral white background and dark goldenrod components combination will be applied without additional accent colors dominating the interface.
I expect the system to support multiple separate simulated exam attempts so that each attempt’s results can be evaluated independently.
I expect to be able to move through questions within a simulated exam using straightforward navigation controls such as next and previous actions.

URL: As a user, I want to practice for my driver's license exam so that I can prepare effectively.
As a user, I want to access a practice question bank so that I can review potential exam questions.
As a user, I want to select practice questions so that I can focus on specific topics or questions I want to study.
As a user, I want to take simulated exams so that I can experience an exam-like environment.
As a user, I want to view my exam scores so that I can understand how well I performed on the simulated exams.
As a user, I want to view error analysis so that I can understand which questions I got wrong and why.
As a user, I want the page background to be floral white so that the interface matches the specified design.
As a user, I want all components colored dark goldenrod so that the website maintains a consistent visual style.
instruction: Please implement a DMV practice test website to help users practice for their driver's license exam. The website should have features such as a practice question bank, simulated exams, and error analysis. Users should be able to select practice questions, take simulated exams, and view error analysis and exam scores. Set page background to floral white; color all components with dark goldenrod.

name: Canadian Nutrition Label Assistant
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me understand and apply Canadian nutrition information for foods and packaging.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the system to recognize common food names, brand names, and general keywords as valid inputs when I search for Canadian nutrition information.
I want to be able to input ingredients using everyday terms rather than scientific names when calculating nutritional values.
I assume the system will allow me to specify serving sizes in common household measures and metric units when entering food quantities.
I expect the nutrition information and label formats to be based specifically on Canadian regulations and standards, not on other countries’ nutrition labeling rules.
I assume the system will cover both single-ingredient foods and multi-ingredient products when providing Canadian nutrition facts information.
I expect the nutrition analysis to handle combinations of multiple ingredients within a single recipe or product formulation.
I want the nutrition facts labels to include all mandatory Canadian nutrition fields such as calories, macronutrients, and key vitamins and minerals as defined by Canadian regulations.
I expect the system to present calculated nutritional values in the same units and reference amounts used on Canadian nutrition facts labels.
I want the packaging design function to reflect required Canadian label elements like the nutrition facts table, ingredient list, and other legally required text areas.
I expect to be able to refine or adjust my search terms and immediately see updated results for Canadian nutrition information.
I want to be able to modify ingredient quantities and serving sizes and quickly recalculate the nutritional values without starting over.
I expect the packaging design process to be interactive, allowing me to adjust layout elements and see how those changes affect compliance with Canadian requirements.
I want the displayed Canadian nutrition facts labels to visually resemble official Canadian nutrition facts tables in layout and styling.
I expect the nutrition analysis results to be presented in a clear, tabular format similar to a nutrition facts label rather than as raw numbers only.
I want the website to consistently use a linen background color across pages to maintain a unified visual appearance.
I expect maroon to be used consistently for key interface components such as headings, buttons, or highlights to enforce the chosen color scheme.

URL: As a user, I want to search for food nutrition information by inputting food names or keywords so that I can find related Canadian nutrition facts labels.
As a user, I want to view Canadian nutrition facts labels so that I can understand food nutrition information.
As a user, I want to input food ingredients and serving sizes so that I can calculate their nutritional value.
As a user, I want to use a nutrition analysis function so that I can understand the nutritional value of specific ingredient combinations.
As a user, I want to design my own food packaging so that it complies with Canadian regulations.
As a user, I want the website background to be linen so that the visual appearance matches the specified design.
As a user, I want components to be defined with maroon so that the interface follows the specified color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a website that displays Canadian nutrition facts labels to help users understand food nutrition information. The website should have a product search function, where users can input food names or keywords (such as apple) to search for related nutrition information. The website should also have a nutrition analysis function, where users can input food ingredients (such as chicken, rice, broccoli) and serving sizes to calculate their nutritional value. Additionally, the website should provide a packaging design function, where users can design their own food packaging according to Canadian regulations. Define background as linen; define components with maroon.
